About

DOAJ team

  • Project and Communications Manager

    Clara Armengou

    Clara has several years of experience in the scholarly publishing industry. She worked at Cambridge University Press as an Open Access Project Manager until 2015. She also works in science communication as a freelancer at the University Pompeu Fabra, Barcelona. Clara speaks Spanish, Catalan, English and some German and French. She loves cetaceans, freediving, cycling, and is an enthusiast cook.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Senior Managing Editor

    Judith Barnsby

    Judith has over 20 years experience in the scholarly publishing industry, working for a range of non-profit society publishers and service providers. She has a keen interest in publishing standards and protocols, and has served on the board of CLOCKSS and as chair of the PALS (publisher and library solutions) working group in the UK.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Kamel Belhamel

    Kamel is Full Professor of Chemistry at the University of Bejaia in Algeria (ORCID ID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9099-8040). He holds his PhD in the field of Process Engineering and Chemistry of Materials Science at the University of Setif in Algeria. He joined the DOAJ team in 2016 as an Ambassador for Northern African and Middle East countries. He is currently a DOAJ Managing Editor, Creative Commons Algeria Chapter lead, director of the Laboratory of Organic Materials at the University of Bejaia in Algeria and editor in chief of Algerian Journal of Natural Products (E-ISSN: 2353-0391). His scientific activity is focused on the chemistry of the Natural Products, scholarly communications and new developments in academic publishing. Father of 3 daughters, he likes travelling, healthy local foods & home-made snacks.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Director and Founder

    Lars Bjørnshauge

    Lars has been working at Danish university libraries for two decades and was Director of Libraries at Lund University, Sweden from 2001 to 2011 and founded the DOAJ in 2003. He became Managing Director of DOAJ in January 2013. He has vast experience in: change management; the re-engineering of academic libraries; the development of information services for research & higher education. He has for two decades been a strong advocate of open access and for providing services to the open access movement. He is co-founder of OpenDOAR, the the Directory of Open Access Books and ThinkCheckSubmit. He is Past-President of the Danish Research Library Organization – Past-VicePresident of the Swedish Library Association – Board member OASPA 2012-2019. Lars is Dane, lives outside Copenhagen, married to Annette, 4 children and 4 grandchildren. He enjoys vegetable gardening, growing cacti and succulents, and playing internet chess.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Sonja Brage

    Sonja is a former Information Librarian from Lund University Library. She has a B.A. in English, Bulgarian and Russian from Lund University and specialises in applications for journals in the Slavonic languages.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Ilaria Fava

    Ilaria is a librarian with several years of experience within the Open Access community in her home country of Italy, where she has dealt with Open Access issues at both a national and international level. She also serves the Göttingen State and University Library working on Open Science projects. Based in Rome and Göttingen, Ilaria loves baking cakes; she speaks Italian, English, some Spanish and a little German.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Alejandra Manco Vega

    Alejandra has a Bachelor’s degree in Information Science and a Master’s degree in Digital Media; she has around ten years of experience in information management, knowledge management and scholarly communication at national and international level.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Database Assistant

    Paula Marjamäki

    Paula is a published researcher and holds a PhD in Biological Sciences from the University of Exeter. She has extensive experience managing and maintaining large databases and has been an advocate for open science for many years.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2020

  • Operations Manager

    Dominic Mitchell

    Dom has worked extensively with the publisher and librarian communities both as a publisher and as an account and project manager. He is responsible for DOAJ’s strategic and operational development, including its technical development, and DOAJ’s profile in social media. He writes the DOAJ blog. In 2019, he was elected to the OASPA Board of Directors.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Editor-in-Chief

    Tom Olijhoek

    Tom has a PhD in molecular microbiology and has spent several years in Africa doing research on malaria, sleeping sickness and meningococcal epidemics. He has been actively advocating open access and open science since 2012 when he joined the Open Knowledge community. At around the same time he became a member of the DOAJ advisory board. His current research interests are development of quality systems for the assessment of scholarly journals and articles, and research in the area of soil microbiology in relation to soil health and human health.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2016
    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Iemima Ploscariu

    Iemima holds a Master of Arts in Comparative History from Central European University, Hungary, and a Master of Letters in Central and East European Studies from the University of St Andrews, Scotland. She is a PhD student and researcher for the Irish Research Council at Dublin City University, Ireland. She volunteered as an Editor for DOAJ from 2014 until 2020 when she became a Managing Editor.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Leena Shah

    Leena works as a Managing Editor for DOAJ. Her primary focus is to ensure that journals from Indonesia, India & neighbouring regions included in DOAJ are good quality OA journals. She joined the team in 2016 as an Ambassador for India. Prior to joining DOAJ she worked as a science librarian at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. This is where she developed a keen interest in scholarly communication & open science. A recent addition to her interests is artificial intelligence in scholarly communication. Leena holds a Masters degree in Information Studies and lives in Singapore. She loves watching sci-fi shows and is enthusiastic about travelling to new places.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2018
    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Cenyu Shen

    Cenyu holds a PhD in Information Systems Science at Hanken School of Economics in Finland. She has spent around seven years on Open Access research with a particular focus on gold OA publishing concerning journals and publishers outside the mainstream. She used to be one of three DOAJ ambassadors for China from 2016 to 2017.

    Conflict of interest statement(s):

    • 2020

  • Managing Editor

    Rikard Zeylon

    Rikard has a Bachelor of Arts degree with a Major in Cultural Sciences and a specialization in publishing.
